subject: Re: [junit] Re: Adding setUp() and tearDown() to TestSuite
msgSnippet: I understood your request for change, but disagree. My signature is metaphorical, not literal.  It really means for every question there is only one answer.

Subject: Re: [junit] Re: Adding setUp() and tearDown() to TestSuite
Message-Id: <20020925113103.0BAE82FD83@...>
From: "Jason Rogers" <jacaetevha@...>
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=109352929

I understood your request for change, but disagree.

My signature is metaphorical, not literal.  It really means for every
question there is only one answer.

=jason
[:question | ^One]

On Tue, 24 Sep 2002 14:43:29 -0700, "Toby Ferguson"
<toby.h.ferguson@...> said:
> This message only has an HTML part -- this is a text generated
> representation
> 
> 
>    Completely off-topic, but shouldn't your signature read
>    [:question | ^forty-two]
>    Toby
>    P.S.  I  guess  that won't make much sense unless you're familiar
>    with
>    the
>    trilogy  "The Restaurant at the End of the Universe" by Douglas
>    Adams.
>    IMHO a
>    pretty  funny  series  of  books,  including  the answer to
>    everything
>    (which is
>    where the suggestion for changing your signature came from).
>    Jason Rogers wrote:
>    > I think this issue stems more from the habit of using JUnit as an
>    > acceptance or interaction testing framework rather than just a unit
>    > testing framework.
>    >
>    > As far as unit tests go, I am 110% with you.  However, the design of
>    > JUnit has made it extremely simple to use for the other two types of
>    >  testing  I  referred  to.   That  being  said, I don't believe this
>    request
>    > should be embodied in JUnit-proper.  Let it be an add-on feature.  I
>    > would even argue to remove TestSetup once people get used to using
>    >  Vladimir's  Add-Ons  project  in SourceForge (or sooner, since most
>    folks
>    >  won't  embrace  change  without  some force to move them from their
>    current
>    > path -- the 2nd law of thermodynamics I believe).
>    >
>    > =jason
>    > [:question | ^One]
>    >
>    > -----Original Message-----
>    > From: kentlbeck [mailto:kentbeck@...]
>    > Sent: Monday, September 23, 2002 2:20 PM
>    > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>    > Subject: [junit] Re: Adding setUp() and tearDown() to TestSuite
>    >
>    > --- In junit@y..., "David Vydra" <yahoogroups@v...> wrote:
>    > > I would like to get the group's opinion about adding setUp() and
>    > > tearDown() methods to the TestSuite class. I think it has several
>    > > advantages:
>    > >
>    > > 1. It makes it similar to TestCase
>    > > 2. It makes it easier for QA engineers, who may not feel
>    > comfortable
>    > > with a decorator like TestSetup (no offense meant to QA engineers
>    > who
>    > > do)
>    > > 3. Sometimes you need to access the suite in the composite after
>    > it
>    > > was wrapped in TestSetup.
>    >
>    > The first design principle of xUnit (good or bad) is independence of
>    > tests. TestSetup is a step away from that, which I regret. The need
>    > for shared setup is IME always a design problem. Solving it by
>    > writing tests differently is the first step on a slippery slope to
>    > making the tests less valuable to programmers.
>    >
>    > Kent
>    >
